intro: Rhamnus purandharensis, commonly known as the Purandharan Indian buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by black, spherical berries that are edible for birds and mammals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
